Authors: Leif Ryvarden, K. W. Ko, Hack Sung Jung
Title:
Phylogenetic relationships of Hapalopilus and related genera
inferred from mitochondrial small subunit ribosomal DNA sequences.
Keywords:
Aphyllophorales; Lopharia; Phanerochaete; Polyporaceae;
Porostereum; polyporic acid; Sarcoporia
Abstract:
To elucidate the evolution of Hapalopilus and related
genera, partial mitochondrial small subunit ribosomal DNAs of 13 species
were sequenced and phylogenetically analyzed. Both neighbor-joining and
parsimony trees showed that species with polyporic acid have evolved
several times and that Hapalopilus, Lopharia, Porostereum and
Phanerochaete were all polyphyletic. The main Hapalopilus group
consisted of four species of Hapalopilus and Porostereum friesii, while
Hapalopilus salmonicolor (= Sarcoporia salmonicolor) came out close to
the species of Irpex and Oxyporus and proved to be a distinct
taxon.
